qas.question: Who first standardized the earliest versions of the Quran?
By what name is the first standardized version of the Quran known?
Who last standardized the earliest versions of the Quran?
Who first standardized the latest versions of the Quran?
By what name is the last standardized version of the Quran known?
By what name is the first standardized version of the Quran unknown?

context: According to the traditional narrative, several <a0_0><b3_0>companions of Muhammad<b3_0/><a0_0/> served as scribes and were responsible for writing down the revelations. Shortly after Muhammad's death, the Quran was compiled by his companions who wrote down and memorized parts of it. These codices had differences that motivated the <a1_0><b4_0><b5_0>Caliph Uthman<b5_0/><b4_0/><a1_0/> to establish a standard version now known as <a2_0><b6_0><b7_0>Uthman's codex<b7_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/>, which is generally considered the archetype of the Quran known today. There are, however, variant readings, with mostly minor differences in meaning.
